Name: Flyway Migrate - Bash
Description: Deploy a database using Flyway from a referenced package.  Variable substitution for the SQL folder is built into the template
Author: twerhti

Properties.Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody:
# Get all of the Parameter values assigned to local variables
relativePath=$(get_octopusvariable "RelativePath")
locations=$(get_octopusvariable "locations")
targetUrl=$(get_octopusvariable "targetUrl")
targetUser=$(get_octopusvariable "targetUser")
targetPassword=$(get_octopusvariable "targetPassword")
runDriftCheck=$(get_octopusvariable "runDriftCheck")
comparePath=$(get_octopusvariable "comparePath")
shadowUrl=$(get_octopusvariable "shadowUrl")
shadowUser=$(get_octopusvariable "shadowUser")
shadowPassword=$(get_octopusvariable "shadowPassword")

# Convert runDriftCheck from string to boolean
if [[ "$runDriftCheck" == "True" ]]
then
	runDriftCheck=true
else
	runDriftCheck=false
fi

# Declaring the path to the NuGet package
packagePath=$(get_octopusvariable "Octopus.Action.Package[FlyWayPackage].ExtractedPath")

# Delcaring path to FlyWay
flywayPath=$packagePath

if [[ ! -z "$relativePath" ]]
then
    $flywayPath=$packagePath$relativePath
fi

flywayCmd=$flywayPath"/flyway"

if [[ ! -z "$locations" ]]
then
    locationsPath=$packagePath$locations
else
    locationsPath=$flywayPath"/sql"
fi

# Logging for troubleshooting
echo "*******************************************"
echo "Logging variables:"
echo " - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -"
echo "FlywayPackageStep: $FlyWayPackageStep"
echo "FlywayPath: $flywayPath"
echo "LocationsPath: $locationsPath"
echo "Target DB -url: $targetUrl"
echo "Target DB -user: $targetUser"
echo "Run drift-check?: $runDriftCheck"
echo "Compare tool path: $comparePath"
echo "Shadow DB -url: $shadowUrl"
echo "Shadow DB -user: $shadowUser"

if [[ "$runDriftCheck" == true ]]
then
    # Can't do drift check without a shadow DB
    if [[ -z "$shadowUrl" ]]
    then
        echo "Cannot run drift check because Shadow DB not provided."
        runDriftCheck=false
    fi
    # Can't do drift check without a comparison tool
    if [[ -z "$comparePath" ]]
    then
        echo "Cannot run drift check as path to comparison tool not provided."
        runDriftCheck=false
    fi
fi


# Drift check preperation
dbPlatform="Unknown"
targetDbVersion=0
targetDbPath="Unknown"

if [[ $runDriftCheck == true ]]
then
    # Determining name and version of target database
    echo "*******************************************"
    echo "Determining name and version of target database:"
    echo " - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -"
    
    # Saving target DB info
    arguments="info -locations=filesystem:$locationsPath -url=$targetUrl -user=$targetUser -password=$targetPassword"
    echo "Determining version of target database:"
    echo "Executing the following: $flywayCmd ${arguments//$targetPassword/********}"
    targetDbInfo=$flywayCmd $arguments
    echo "Target DB info:"
    echo "$targetDbInfo"

    # Get the current schema version
    $targetDbVersion=$(echo "$targetDbInfo" | grep "Schema version" | cut -d' ' -f 3-)

    echo "Target database is at version $targetDbVersion"

    # Finding connection string for target DB
    echo "Target database connection string $targetUrl"
    
    if [[ $targetUrl == *sqlserver* ]] 
    then
        $dbPlatform="SQLServer"       
    fi
    
    if [[ $targetUrl == *mysql* ]]
    then
        $dbPlatform="MySQL"       
    fi
    
    if [[ $targetUrl == *oracle* ]]
    then
        $dbPlatform="Oracle"       
    fi    
    
    echo "Database platform $dbPlatform detected."
fi

if [[ $dbPlatform == "Unknown" ]] && [[ $runDriftCheck == true ]]
then
    echo "Cannot run drift check!"
    echo "Drift check only supported for SQL Server, Oracle or MySQL."
    echo "Cannot determine from FlyWay info if your database platform is supported."
    $runDriftCheck = false
fi

if [[ $runDriftCheck == true ]]
then
    # Building a shadow DB for drift check
    echo "*******************************************"
    echo "Building a shadow DB for drift check:"
    echo " - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -"
    #   In a future version it would be cool to build the shadow DB ourselves
    #   and to clean up afterwards. For now, however, asking the user to provide 
    #   a shadow DB for us removes the requirement to work out how to build a fresh
    #   DB on 3 different DB platforms. It also means we don't need to worry about
    #   credentials etc
    #   $shadowDbPath = $targetDbPath + "_SHADOW"
    
    echo "Cleaning shadow database"
    arguments=("clean" "-url=$shadowUrl" "-user=$shadowUser" "-password=$shadowPassword")
    echo "Executing the following: $flywayCmd ${arguments//$shadowPassword/********}"
    bash $flywayCmd $arguments
    
    echo "Migrating shadow database up to current target version"
    arguments=("migrate" "-locations=filesystem:$locationsPath" "-url=$shadowUrl" "-user=$shadowUser" "-password=$shadowPassword" "-target=$targetDbVersion")
    echo "Executing the following: $flywayCmd ${arguments//$shadowPassword/********}"
    bash $flywayCmd $arguments

    # Using comparison tool to check for drift
    echo "*******************************************"
    echo "Using comparison tool to check for drift:"
    echo " - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -"
    
    function getServer (){
    	local connectionString=${1}
        
        # Split the connectiuon string name
        IFS='/' read -ra connectionStringArray <<< "$connectionString"
        
        
        return ${connectionStringArray[3]}
    }

    function getDbName (){
    	local connectionString=${1}
        # Note: For MySQL this may return key values as well. e.g:
        # <database>?<key1>=<value1>&<key2>=<value2>...
        # Should fix this!!!!
        echo "Warning: Function getDbName() does not handle MySQL connection strings fully!"
        
        # Split the connectiuon string name
        IFS='/' read -ra connectionStringArray <<< "$connectionString"
        
        return ${connectionStringArray[4]}
    }

    # SQL Server
    if [[ $dbPlatform == "SQLServer" ]]
    then
        # Details for target DB
        targetServer=$(getServer $targetUrl)
        targetDb=$(getDbName $targetUrl)
        
        # Details for shadow DB
        shadowServer=$(getServer $shadowUrl)
        shadowDb=$(getDbName $shadowUrl)
        
        # Drift report name and location
        currentdate=$(date  '+%Y-%m-%d %T')
        reportName="FlySQLDriftReport_$targetDb_$currentdate."
        reportPath=$flywayPath"/driftreport"
        
        mkdir $reportPath
        
        arguments="/s1=$targetServer /db1=$targetDb /u1=$targetUser /p1=$targetPassword /s2=$shadowServer /db2=$shadowDb /u2=$shadowUser /p2=$shadowPassword /assertidentical /r=$reportPath\reportName.html /rt=Simple"

        echo "Executing the following command: $comparePath ${arguments//$targetPassword/********}"
        $comparePath $arguments 
        
        if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]
        then
            echo "Drift check failed. For details see report here: $reportPath"
            exit 1
        else
            echo "Drift check passed."
        fi
    fi
    
    # Oracle
    if [[ $dbPlatform == "Oracle" ]]
    then
        
        # "Target" and "Source" names are very confusing.
        # Consistently in this PS script I have used target
        # to refer to the database we intend to deploy to.
        # At this point we need to use that database as
        # the source in order to create a roll-back
        # script should the drift-check fail.
        # Hence the terms source and target are used
        # for opposite purposes when using Schema Compare
        # for Oracle command line tool.
        
        # Details for target DB
        targetTns=$(getServer $targetUrl)
        targetSchema=$(getDbName $targetUrl)
        commandsource="$targetUser/$targetPassword@$targetTns{$targetSchema}"
        
        # Details for shadow DB
        shadowServer=$(getServer $shadowUrl)
        shadowDb=$(getDbName $shadowUrl)
        target="$sourceUser/$sourcePassword@$sourceTns{$sourceSchema}"
        
        # Drift report name and location
        currentdate=$(date  '+%Y-%m-%d %T')
        reportName="FlySQLDriftReport_$targetSchema_$currentdate."
        reportPath=$flywayPath"/driftReport"
        
        mkdir $reportPath
        
        arguments="/source=$source /target=$target /r=$reportPath\reportName.html /rt=Simple"

        echo "Executing the following command:  $comparePath $arguments"
        bash $comparePath $arguments 
        if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]
        then
            echo "Drift check failed. For details see report here: $reportPath"
            exit 1
        else
            echo "Drift check passed."Throw
        fi
        
    fi
    # MySQL
    if [[ $dbPlatform == "MySQL" ]]
	then
        # Details for target DB
        targetServerPort=$(getServer $targetUrl)
        
        IFS='/' read -ra targetServerArray <<< "$targetServerPort"
        
        targetServer=${targetServerArray[0]}
        targetPort=${targetServerArray[1]}
        targetDb=$(getDbName $targetUrl)

        # Details for shadow DB        
        shadowServerPort=$(getServer $targetUrl)
        shadowServer=${targetServerArray[0]}
        shadowPort=${targetServerArray[1]}
        shadowDb=$(getDbName $shadowUrl)

        # Drift report name and location        
        currentdate=$(date  '+%Y-%m-%d %T')
        reportName="FlySQLDriftReport_$targetDb_$currentdate"
        reportPath=$flywayPath"/driftReport"
        
        mkdir $reportPath 
        
        arguments="-verbose -server1=$shadowServer -port1=$shadowPort -database1=$shadowDb -username1=$shadowUser -password1=$shadowPassword -server2=$targetServer -database2=$targetDb -port2=$targetPort -username2=$targetUser -password2=$targetPassword -assertIdentical -report=$reportPath\$reportName.html -reportType=Simple -scriptfile=$reportPath\undoDrift.sql"

        echo "Executing the following command: & $comparePath ${arguments//$targetPassword/********}"
        bash $comparePath $arguments 
        if [[ $? -ne 0 ]]
        then
            echo "Drift check failed. For details see report here: $reportPath"
            exit 1
        else
            echo "Drift check passed."Throw
        fi
    fi
fi

# Executing deployment
echo "*******************************************"
echo "Executing deployment:"
echo " - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -"
    arguments="migrate -locations=filesystem:$locationsPath -url=$targetUrl -user=$targetUser -password="$targetPassword""
echo "Executing the following command:  $flywayCmd ${arguments//$targetPassword/********}"

bash $flywayCmd $arguments

Parameters.Name: RelativePath
Parameters.Label: Relative path to flyway.cmd (optional)
Parameters.HelpText: If your FlyWay project is not in the root of your NuGet package specify the relative path here.

Parameters.Name: locations
Parameters.Label: -locations (relative path, optional)
Parameters.HelpText:
Comma-separated list of locations to scan recursively for migrations. The location type is determined by its prefix.
Unprefixed locations or locations starting with classpath: point to a package on the classpath and may contain both sql and java-based migrations.
Locations starting with filesystem: point to a directory on the filesystem and may only contain sql migrations.

Parameters.Name: targetUrl
Parameters.Label: Target -url (required)
Parameters.HelpText:
The url of the target database in the format specified in the default flyway.conf file.

E.g.
SQL Server: jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://host:port/database
Oracle: jdbc:oracle:thin:@//host:port/service
MySQL: jdbc:mysql://host:port/database

Parameters.Name: targetUser
Parameters.Label: Target -user (required)
Parameters.HelpText: The username to connect to the target database.

Parameters.Name: targetPassword
Parameters.Label: Target -password (required)
Parameters.HelpText: The password to connect to the target database.

Parameters.Name: runDriftCheck
Parameters.Label: Run pre-deploy drift check
Parameters.HelpText:
Check for drift with Redgate comparison tool.

_Requirements_

Requires that a Redgate command line comparison tool is installed on the target machine.

For SQL Server: SQL Compare

http://www.red-gate.com/products/sql-development/sql-compare/

For Oracle: Schema Compare for Oracle

http://www.red-gate.com/products/oracle-development/schema-compare-for-oracle/

For MySQL: MySQL Compare

https://www.red-gate.com/products/mysql/mysql-compare/

All tools include a free trial licence for a limited period of time.

_Limitations_

SQL Server, Oracle and MySQL only

Parameters.Name: comparePath
Parameters.Label: Path to Redgate comparison tool (required for drift-check)
Parameters.HelpText:
Checking for drift requires a database comparison tool. This template uses the Redgate tooling.

Please provide the path to a Redgate command line tool. The default paths are

SQL Compare (SQL Server):

C:\Program Files (x86)\Red Gate\SQL Automation Pack 1\SC\SQLCompare.exe

Schema Compare for Oracle:

C:\Program Files\Red Gate\Schema Compare for Oracle 3\SCO.exe

MySQL Compare:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Red Gate\MySQL Compare 1\MC.exe

Parameters.Name: shadowUrl
Parameters.Label: Shadow -url (required for drift-check)
Parameters.HelpText:
The url of the target database in the format specified in the default flyway.conf file.

E.g.
SQL Server: jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://host:port/database
Oracle: jdbc:oracle:thin:@//host:port/service
MySQL: jdbc:mysql://host:port/database

Parameters.Name: shadowUser
Parameters.Label: Shadow -user (required for drift-check)
Parameters.HelpText: The username to connect to the shadow database.

Parameters.Name: shadowPassword
Parameters.Label: Shadow -password (required for drift-check)
Parameters.HelpText: The password to connect to the shadow database.

Parameters.Name: FlyWayPackage
Parameters.Label: Flyway package
Parameters.HelpText: The package that contains the Flyway project.
